relevant_findings.treadmill_stress_test: 1-mm horizontal ST-segment depression in V6 and borderline 1-mm ST-segment elevation in V4R

cardiac_catheterization.findings: Normal coronary arteries, no discrete wall motion abnormalities, normal systolic function
cardiac_catheterization.small_apical_aneurysm: Visualized with a radiolucent filling defect

changes_over_time.description: Five months later, the patient presented with inferior ST-elevation myocardial infarction, the filling defect in the apical aneurysm was not seen.

cardiac_magnetic_resonance_imaging.findings: Small apical aneurysm characteristic of a remnant from a sump, with 2 discrete areas of transmural late gadolinium enhancement corresponding to the infarct territories
cardiac_magnetic_resonance_imaging.left_ventricular_systolic_function: Mildly depressed with ejection fraction of 44%

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initial finding of the filling defect was not present at the time of the myocardial infarction.
